summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) training sign-in log and accompanying presentation materials for a Suicide Prevention/SHU (Special Housing Unit) training course held at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on December 7, 2018. The training materials detail suicide risk factors, management strategies for high-risk inmates (including mentally ill, behavior disordered, sex offender, and protective custody inmates), and emergency response procedures.

events.title: MCC New York Suicide Prevention/SHU Training
events.description: A Bureau of Prisons training course held at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, focusing on suicide prevention strategies for inmates in Special Housing Units (SHUs).

keyFacts: A suicide prevention training was conducted at MCC New York on December 7, 2018, for staff managing the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
Training materials state that 30-80% of inmate suicides in the BOP occur on locked units like SHUs, and single cells in these units are especially risky.
High-risk inmate groups identified include the mentally ill, behavior disordered inmates, sex offenders, and protective custody inmates.
The training recommended double-celling inmates in SHUs to reduce isolation and suicide risk, unless a compelling reason exists for single-celling.
The materials reference a 'Psychology Advisory List' (TRU-SCOPE) and 'PSY Alert' system to track inmates with mental health conditions who may become dangerous or suicidal in the SHU.
